text: "Everything We Need" is a song by American recording artist Kanye West, from his ninth studio album, Jesus Is King (2019). The song was recorded as a new version of the track "The Storm". The song features vocals from American musician Ty Dolla Sign and American singer Ant Clemons. == Background and recording == In the fall of 2018, Ant Clemons met up with West, Chance the Rapper and Candace Owens in Chicago. During a freestyle session involving him, West and Chance the Rapper, "Everything We Need" was came up with. Ant Clemons revealed in October 2019 that the song stemmed from a conversation with West about Christ and stated: "A lot of the best songs come from conversations." He elaborated on being around West, claiming that it "has been like the best time to absorb my surroundings. I try to listen, because you'll hear a lot of the things that you want to know, without even having to ask." "Everything We Need" is a new version of the track "The Storm". The track leaked online in July 2019, with it including vocals from Ty Dolla Sign and deceased American rapper XXXTentacion, the latter of which was cut from the final version of the track. "Everything We Need" was one of the three tracks that went through its mixing being fixed that lead to the release of Jesus Is King being delayed. == Credits and personnel == Credits adapted from Tidal. * Writer(s) – Kanye West, Anthony Clemons, Bradford Lewis, Cydel Young, Federico Vindver, Isaac DeBoni, Jahmal Gwin, Michael Mulé, Mike Dean, Ronald Spence Jr., Tyrone William Griffin, Jr. * Production – West, FNZ, Ronny J * Co-production – BoogzDaBest, Federico Vindver * Additional production – Mike Dean Credits for the IMAX version of "Everything We Need" from the Jesus Is King film. * Writer(s) – Clemons, Uforo Ebong, Griffin, Jr., Spence Jr., West == Charts == ===Weekly charts=== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" style="text- align:center" |- ! scope="col"| Chart (2019) ! scope="col"| Peak position |- |- |- |- |- ! scope="row"| Estonia (Eesti Ekspress) | 35 |- |- ! scope="row"| Greece International Digital Singles (IFPI) | 71 |- ! scope="row"| Iceland (Tonlist) | 19 |- ! scope="row" | Latvia (LAIPA) | 20 |- ! scope="row"| Lithuania (AGATA) | 42 |- |- |- |- |- |- |- |- |- |- ! scope="row"| US Gospel Songs (Billboard) | 5 |- |- ! scope="row" | US Rolling Stone Top 100 | 8 |} ===Year-end charts=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" style="text-align:center" |- !scope="col"|Chart (2019) !scope="col"|Position |- ! scope="row"| US Christian Songs (Billboard) | 46 |- ! scope="row"| US Gospel Songs (Billboard) | 9 |} ==See also== *2019 in hip hop music ==References== ==External links== * Category:2019 songs Category:Kanye West songs Category:Song recordings produced by Kanye West Category:Song recordings produced by Mike Dean (record producer) Category:Songs written by Cyhi the Prynce Category:Songs written by Kanye West Category:Songs written by Mike Dean (record producer) Category:Songs written by Ronny J Category:Songs written by Ty Dolla Sign Category:Songs written by Ant Clemons Category:Ty Dolla Sign songs
